alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in south central Virginia, Dinwiddie and Prince George. In southeast Virginia, Southampton, Surry and Sussex. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain has occurred due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to continue in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waverly, Wakefield, Sussex, Ivor, Dendron, Stony Creek, Homeville, Carson, Dewitt, Booker, Templeton, Newville, Lumberton, Huske, Littleton, Manry, Wharfs Store, Cherry Hill, Booth Fork and Butterworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Dinwiddie; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex
